title: Olivia Newton John's daughter Chloe Lattanzi sparks controversy over guns
title_page: Olivia Newton John's daughter Chloe Lattanzi sparks controversy over guns | Daily Mail Online
text:
Olivia Newton-John's daughter has shared a bizarre photograph of her father sprawled across a bed with assault rifles to campaign for the use of guns 'for fun'.
Chloe Lattanzi, the actress's daughter with former husband Matt Lattanzi, uploaded the photograph on Monday, using the opportunity to voice her views on the gun control.
The 29-year-old described the weapons as 'beautiful' and claimed her family used them only to shoot at 'empty cans and logs' in Portland, Oregon, where her father lives.
Controversial: Chloe Lattanzi attracted criticism after sharing this photograph of her father sprawled across a bed with two assault rifles and a smaller gun while a dog sniffed around the weapons
In the photograph, 56-year-old Matt is seen posing next to two rifles and a smaller weapon while a dog climbs on the bed.
Insisting that both guns had their safety locks on, she wrote: 'Not loaded. Safety on. Beautiful rifles.'
Adding that no one in her family used the weapons to hunt, she continued: 'If you eat meat don't come on here talking about guns are killing machines.
'We don't eat meat so us shooting guns at targets (is) far less harmful than people supporting the slaughter and cruelty to animals (sic)'.
Family: Chloe (seen above with her mother Olivia Newton-John) made the comments while visiting her father in Oregon
Some followers pointed out the controversy in her post, with one arguing: 'Just like any other gun they can be used properly for sport or improperly for killing. No more lethal than a revolver or any other firearm.'
An adamant Chloe responded by telling how her 'dad and fianc√© love guns' before asking: 'If you don't kill with guns, why are they a problem? I don't get it.'
However on Monday, the blonde returned to social media to tell followers she had been 'too scared' to go shooting herself at a range.
'Too scared': Later the 29-year-old admitted she had been 'too scared' to go shooting herself at a range
Scrutiny: The singer later uploaded a photograph of a child at the same range with a rifle, with one user commenting beneath it to express their discomfort
Posting an image of herself in a green parka coat, she wrote: 'I couldn't shoot. 2 scary. I'd rather go to a petting zoo and cuddle fuzzy baby animals (sic).'
She later shared another image of a young boy standing next to a rifle which prompted further scrutiny.
'Doesn't look right,' said one follower beneath the photograph of the child.
Daily Mail Australia has contacted a representative for Chloe and Olivia Newton-John in relation to this article.
Parents: Chloe is Olivia's only child with her second husband Matt. The trio are seen above in 1991 when she was five
Speaking out: Chloe pleaded with followers that if no one was injured through the use of guns she could not see 'the problem'
Her comments come as the debate surrounding gun control in the U.S. rages on, with President Obama last week shedding tears as he discussed the issue.
Urging reform on the issue, he wept: 'All of us need to demand a Congress brave enough to stand up to the gun lobby's lies.'
The President had been paying tribute to the victims of gun massacres across the U.S. when he made the emotional plea.
Chloe is Olivia Newton-John's only child with her first husband Matt.
